pros: Friendly environment and coworkers - Supportive leadership- Good benefits- Excellent work life balance- Hybrid work option- Great culture -Team building retreats and fun outings.
Benefits. Parking. Inside gym. Remote work.
cons: Former employees have been harassed to submit positive reviews to glass-door to offset the negative reviews. If you address valid concerns during team meetings you will be targeted and silenced by the HR team. With inflation at a all time high, lower to mid level workers are not seeing the same level of wage increases that high level executives have. For an organization that prides itself on quality of health standards, it is the most toxic and unhealthy working establishment I have ever worked for. Ironic their mission is to better health quality standards but are the causes of so many employees feelings burnt out and unsupported. This organization is terrible with building trust and moral. So many people are currently on leave due to having no other ways to manage the day to day bullying and workload stress. High turn over rate. New contractors being hired routinely to make up for all of the employees who quit or go on leave due to the work load. The HR team is arguably the most toxic in its industry. They gaslights their employees who give them constructive criticism.

review_title: Don't let the awards fool you
pros: Good benefits plan, pension, amazing ground level employees.
cons: Too many layers of management. Mid-level people managers have ZERO people skills. They use intimidation and bullying tactics on the regular. The toxic culture is beyond! Leadership jet-sets around the world while ground level staff have more work then they could ever possibly accomplish. Spending is shameful for a not-for-profit. They conveniently re-org every other year to purge staff, only to go on hiring frenzies in the months to follow. Anyone with any expertise in hospital accreditation (or anything) has long since left. The rats are running the ship now. Beware - it is not what it seems.
Nothing to report really art this point
- Lots of bureaucracy - Pay is not great compared to other industries - Takes years to get something approved - A lot of legacy applications (VB.NET)

pros: Some teams are awesome while others are quite toxic. In general the company has a great mission, vision, and values but may not live up to them.
cons: See above - your experience here will depend on your team and role

job_title: Training and Development Specialist in Ottawa, ON
pros: Fantastic and flexible place to work
cons: The workload can be a little heavy at times, but this may be due to the pandemic.
Chaotic and top heavy management, antiquated technology leading to a lot of meaningless extra work. No room to advance in my field. HR is legitimately one of the most toxic I have ever seen.

pros: Could be a good starting point for some people. Team lunches were nice.
cons: Many fake people, management (upper or department) does not care about many of the associates (my department head laughed when she said they were "restructuring" and my position was no longer available), quick turn over time (during the 8 months I was there, I think I saw 4 people from my department quit/get let go). Management is not good.

review_title: Weak executive team, low potential for growth/revenue, toxic culture
pros: Benefits, pay, gym, parking lot, quality of office space/building
cons: Never seen a Chief Exec Officer be so bad at leading and caring for staff. Weak leadership team, especially for CEO, HR and International. Not bad people but just individually incompetent in their roles and unaccountable for high turnover, unclear direction for AC/HSO and shameful growth internationally since 2017. This organization has mostly failed to reinvent itself. The HSO model was a great idea but the execution was awful and the transition led to so many key resignations from which we didn't recover. Nationally we are stagnant. Internationally, we have been regressing since 2017. While most companies leverage technology to reinvent themselves, this is instead their biggest weakness with IT leaders having no technology experience from previous roles in other companies. Outsource tech development or hire strong tech innovators and engineering leaders.

pros: Pay is reasonable and competent level with engineers is high
cons: Management forms their own team that didn't include the people doing the actual work

pros: Good benefits and great team members to work around with. Nice spacious office
cons: Not many that I can think of, just wish they had a Toronto office.

no worklife balance
bullying and abusive leaders
high employee burnout rates

review_title: From top to bottom slowly, surely on their way to the graveyard of once great organizations! HSO/AC same organization
pros: Pension plan, renovated building and colleagues
cons:
•	Bad internal culture makes retention nearly impossible no matter how good are the people they hire 
•	Objectives constantly change 
•	Constant changes in direction due to poor management skills has not stopped since 2016 – people vaguely remember the previous good years when people enjoyed coming at work doing interesting projects that went somewhere and felt valued
•	You may ask who’s getting promoted internally? Here is the real answer: People who are friends with directors and do not have a strong moral compass to endure their amateurish management skills
•	If you do not have that kind of friend and are looking for a stagnant job opportunity, this is the place for you! 
•	The organization is unable to live up to brand promises and unwilling to talk about any major challenges
•	 Engaged employees make the brand stronger: this principle is clearly not understood by neither Accreditation Canada or HSO Health Standards Organization. The company has so many great talents and they do not know how to manage their best assets. We had comments from clients and consultants finding certain executives arrogant and disconnected from their reality demonstrating a lack of empathy with their situation. Unmotivated employees and arrogant executives can only bring a negative outlook on the organization.

review_title: Micromanagement and lack of leadership stay away
job_title: Sales Associate Market Development Lead in Ottawa, ON
pros:
Benefits 
Possibility to travel 
Nice building
Food

cons: Lack of leadership, mediocre practices ruin what could be a great organization if Accreditation Canada and HSO are the same company they should have the same page, their websites are linked

pros: Good place to start your career
cons: Many barriers need to be overcome because of bad management
